page.title: 04CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Some of the houses in Pennington Square are over a hundred years old.Up to the 1960's the New Forest ponies used to wander freely around the village.They caused a football match to be stopped on the school field as they stampeded past the young footballers.After much protesting and many photographs the school campus was fenced off and cattle grids built into many of the forest roads. the old village infants school still stands.It was a photographer's studio,then it became a cafe which caught fire.Now it is a workshop.The old junior school is a furniture restoring factory. Where the village fish and chip shop and fishmongers now stand used to be the site of Priestlands Farm on whose land the present Infant,Junior and Comprehensive Schools have been built.
